benchmark_details.name: M5 (Multimodal Multilingual Multicultural Benchmark)
benchmark_details.overview: M5 is a comprehensive benchmark designed to evaluate Large Multimodal Models (LMMs) on diverse vision-language tasks within a multilingual and multicultural context. It includes eight datasets covering five tasks and 41 languages, focusing on underrepresented languages and culturally diverse images.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To fill the gap of multimodal multilingual benchmarks and examine the performance of LMMs across various languages.

data.source: Mixed datasets including xGQA, MaXM, XVNLI, MaRVL, XM3600, and new datasets M5-VGR and M5-VLOD.
data.annotation: Annotated by native speakers of each language for visual and linguistic tasks.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on relaxed accuracy and standard evaluation metrics for image captioning.
methodology.interpretation: Performance disparity analysis across high and low-resource languages.
methodology.baseline_results: Random baseline performance for different datasets.
methodology.validation: Extensive evaluation of 18 LMMs across five tasks.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Performance disparities between market-focused languages and underrepresented languages.
targeted_risks.harm: Highlighting ongoing challenges in achieving equitable AI across languages and cultures.
